definitions.definition: A military rank between captain and lieutenant colonel.
definitions.example: He used to be a major in the army.

definitions.definition: The main area of study of a student working toward a degree at a college or university.
definitions.example: Midway through his second year of college, he still hadn't chosen a major.

definitions.definition: A student at a college or university concentrating on a given area of study.
A large, commercially successful company, especially a record label that is bigger than an indie.
(British slang) An elder brother (especially at a public school).
A large leaf-cutter ant that acts as a soldier, defending the nest.
To concentrate on a particular area of study as a student in a college or university
definitions.example: I have decided to major in mathematics.

definitions.definition: Greater in number, quantity, or extent
definitions.example: the major part of the assembly

definitions.definition: Of full legal age, having attained majority
Of a scale that follows the pattern: tone - tone - semitone - tone - tone - tone - semitone
Being the larger of two intervals denoted by the same ordinal number.
Containing the note a major third (four half steps) above the tonic.
(campanology) Bell changes rung on eight bells.
